class.name: PreListener
class.description: Listener type for immediate interaction events. Allowed types are CbEvent.PRE only and as such is not an argument to the constructor.

property.name: cbType1
property.description: First CbType for shapes/bodies handled by listener

detail.description: CbType matching the first shape/body's listener is intended for

property.name: cbType2
property.description: Second CbType for shapes/bodies handled by listener

detail.description: CbType matching the second shape/body's listener is intended for

Function handler (non-optional). Note that although the argument is an Arbiter (The first such arbiter to be handled internally) this action can occur between shapes/bodies. It is not guaranteed that the same arbiter will be supplied in the case of the handler returning #_ONCE.

Marks that the handler is to be treat as pure whenever the two body/shapes remain unchanged and so allow nape to put the objects to sleep. If the handler is not pure, then nape will make no assumptions and not allow the objects to sleep when the handler returns #_ONCE. If you mark the handler as pure when it is not, then the objects may sleep when you do not expect them to and you 'can' do 'listener.handler = listener.handler' to refresh nape that the handler has infact changed even though it has been marked pure

Construct new PreListener. If pure, nape will assume that the result of invoking the handler will not change whenever the two interactors are unchanged and allow the objects to go to sleep should the handler be returning IGNORE_ONCE/ACCEPT_ONCE.
